v8:item.v8:content: Retrieving the list of available applications…
Cannot retrieve the list of cloud applications.
Data exchange is executed using internal service recourses. You can set up a synchronization schedule. It is the fastest method in the list.
Data exchange is started by a managing application (service manager). A schedule is set up by the service administrator and is read-only.

You need to specify data for authorization in another application. You cannot set up a synchronization schedule. Only manual data exchange is available. This method is used to set up an exchange with an application located outside the service.
Connect to another application on this computer or in the local network
This option is recommended if both applications are located on the same computer or in the local network (in the same office).
Connect to another application over the Internet
This option is recommended if the other application is located in another network (in another office) and Internet connection can be established.
Connect from another application over the Internet (passive mode)
With this connection option, this application sends and receives data over the Internet only upon request from the peer application.
To continue the setup, provide a configuration file with EnterpriseData synchronization settings created in the peer application.
Synchronize data using a file, without connecting to the other application

If LAN or Internet connection to the other application cannot be established, it is recommended that you use other communication channels: a network directory, an FTP resource, or email. The peer applications can run the synchronization autonomously at different times. This option is suitable for data synchronization with applications located both in other networks (offices) and in the same network.
Name of connection settings file for import

If a file with connection parameters is lost, generate a new file: 1. Open the other application. 2. Open the data synchronization window. 3. Select the required data synchronization and open its parameters. 4. In the command bar of the form, click "All actions", and then click "Get data synchronization settings for another application".
You can import connection parameters from the file that was generated in the peer application during data synchronization setup.
The application URL (as in a web browser). Example: https://website.domain/database/123.
On this computer or LAN computer
Synchronize data using a local or network directory
Use local or network directory to synchronize data
Synchronize data using an FTP server directory
Use FTP server directory to synchronize data
It is recommended that you select the check box if errors occur during the exchange due to different file encodings. If you select the check box, also select it in the peer application.
Connection check online waiting decoration picture
Connecting to the peer application. Please wait…
Connection check offline waiting decoration picture
Checking data transfer parameters. Please wait…
Configured synchronization between infobases already exists.

<color #FF0000>Warning! </> This operation cannot be undone and is intended only to resolve a synchronization error associated with duplicate exchange settings in infobases that were obtained by copying.
This operation is not recommended for running synchronizations.
<colorstyle -16>Warning.</> If you continue the setup, the exchange node code for this infobase will change. If there are already configured exchanges in the infobase, they might malfunction.
Data synchronization parameters in this application
The connection settings are successfully saved.
Name of connection settings file for import
Use local or network directory to synchronize data
Use FTP server directory to synchronize data
Refresh the list of available applications.
Save connection settings to a file.
